intro: Dichoropetalum munbyi, commonly known as the Munby's dichoropetalum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lipped flowers, which are typically pink or white in color. It grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
